顺便提一下：在gcam支持魅族16的长焦头之后，我拿gcam的长焦成片和原生的对比了下，发现gcam拍出的要明显广一点。原生如果是等效52mm的话gcam拍出来目测大概是45mm
虽然45mm也属于我比较喜欢的标头焦短，但可以看出魅族16的2000万2X长焦头也是裁切之后插值出来的，实际焦距应该是1.7X左右
裁切的同时也意味着实际用到的CMOS大小变小了，原来是1/3寸的话，大概实际用到的是1/3.5寸
一加7pro这个裁切比如果原来是1/3寸的，裁完之后是1/4.1寸

咲月露娜:
Why OnePlus 3x zoom advertised isn't wrong
Photographer here, I have read and saw many people are unhappy with OnePlus 'false advertising'. I'm here to tell you why it's not.
DSLR camera have sensor size; 35mm Full frame, and a crop of that in 1.6x factor called APS-C. You can use your 50mm Full frame lenses on your APS-C and the crop factor will make it a FOCAL length equivalent of 80mm. This 80mm give your a more zoomed in FOV, or field of view.
Many fullframe DSLR have the option to have this crop in their setting. And lots of professional sport photographer will use their fullframe lens on a crop sensor body for the zoomed in FOV, because telephoto lenses are big and heavy.
This is basically what OnePlus is doing, giving you a larger sensor with a 50mm lens, they crop it down to an 80mm lens by changing the sensor. Cropping the large sensor does reduce the pixel so they said 8Mp, which is not wrong.
Being a photographer, I understand this concept clearly and I'm glad that they put a larger sensor on there as oppose to using a small sensor with meaningless amount of pixel, more pixel isn't a good thing!!
Any other photographer out there have a different take on this? Don't leave it to clueless news site shaping your opinion.
Edit: https://www.the-digital-picture.com/Canon-Lenses/Canon-Lens-Magnification-Value.aspx
Link to describe how zoom calculation work. Oneplus widest angle is 17mm and telephoto is 55 mm. so 55/17= approximately 3x zoom. Not misleading, PR department just doesn't have the same photography knowledge as the engineer. While the cropped in 8MP image is around 86mm equivalent, they could have just easily advertise 86/17= 5x zoom!!
Sensor cropping is beneficial in a way that it only use the center of the lens, resulting in a sharper image and less blur/dark corners. I think this is why OnePlus use the full sensor for portrait, in portrait mode it blur out the background anyways so sharpness does not matter.
https://www.reddit.com/r/oneplus/comments/bsific/why_oneplus_3x_zoom_advertised_isnt_wrong/

lwa190212:
以前说光学变焦一般都是指一个镜头在同一个传感器下镜头的变焦，那个时代要是像素裁一裁是要叫做数码变焦的，至于换一个镜头那就更不叫变焦镜头了
现在是三个镜头三个传感器，传感器的画幅还可以再切一切随时变化，结果强行套用概念，传统的定义在延拓的过程中扯着蛋了
不过对真正的拍摄者而言在这类技术下纠结这种词汇并没有什么价值

lwa190212:
real_zyf 发表于 2019-5-25 22:49
拿画幅算还行，这拿像素算是什么沙雕操作
这个操作的思路我觉得还算可以理解的：
暂且不考虑镜头在不同焦段的表现比如最大光通量或是像场平坦度的不同，光学变焦保证了视角变化时同一块底下的画质不变
不过在这个思路里画质可能直接退化成像素了
单位像素画质不变的情况下在画面中裁剪出一块不算光学变焦
比如以前部分数码相机会标注光学变焦A倍(像素数M)，数码变焦B倍(像素数N)
通常A^2*M=B^2*N
用手机代入拟合出类似的相机，就会用标准镜头的像素M和最后得到的像素量N和B推算A了
然而对手机来说根本得不到A倍焦距的像素数M的相片，所以A倍光学变焦只是一个拟合结果，并不真实存在，那就显得有点骚操作了
